shell.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: the hard outer part that covers and protects an egg, nut, or seed
shell.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: Never buy eggs with cracked shells.
shell.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: the hard protective covering of an animal such as a snail, mussel, or crab
shell.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: The children were collecting shells on the beach.
shell.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: a metal container, like a large bullet, which is full of an explosive substance and is fired from a large gun
shell.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: We ran for cover as shells dropped all around us.
shell.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: a metal tube containing a bullet and an explosive substance
shell.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: the outside structure of something, especially the part of a building that remains when the rest of it has been destroyed
shell.translation[0].definitions[4].exam: the burnt-out shell of a nightclub
shell.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: to fire shells from large guns at something
shell.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: The army has been shelling the town since yesterday.
shell.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: to remove something such as beans or nuts from a shell or pod
shell.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: Josie was shelling peas in the kitchen.
shell.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: a very large international oil company which has many petrol stations world-wide
